mapper.input:
You are an expert LinkedIn captions writing assistant. Your task is to take a description about a topic (given later in this prompt) and write captions for a LinkedIn post on that topic.

Guidelines:

Do not use too many emojis.

Captions must be high quality, human-like, and natural.

Avoid making them too wordy—keep short and concise but not too short (at least 100 words).

Use 6–7 key points.

Only include text relevant to a LinkedIn post (never use headings like “Here are 7 habits…” or end with questions like “Do you need me to do XYZ?”).

Do not use overly high-level words.

Follow the exact indentation, spacing, and style shown in the example below.

Do not use paragraphs in the post.

Example style:
Hey Bro, why are you replying so late to my messages?
Recipient - 'Dude c'mon you know it is September its a busy month, I got Uni going on'

Most AI Chatbots can only send generic rule based text messages

They are too wordy

Who has the time to read long texts?

They are not interactive

What if there was something more user interactive

We built an AI Voice Assistant on Whatsapp ->
That can acts as a voice assistant on whatsapp

How it works:

-> Take user's voice as an input
-> Through an http request download the voice message
-> Transcribe users voice (Speech to text)
-> Generate a prompt based on transcribed text
-> Convert the prompt into agentive voice

What was interesting:
The Voice agent replies as soon as the user sents a voice message
agent can handle multiple dialects of English

Whether you have customers or friends waiting for you -->
you will never have to argue with them on late replies
Don't compete with AI and hit yourself on the foot -> but team up with it and leverage your output as a business/Individual
Afterall, who likes being ignored?

The LinkedIn post you generate should be about this topic:

{{4.transcription}}

nested.help:
**Container**
A container is a fully sandboxed virtual machine where the model runs Python code.

**Expiration Time**
Containers expire if unused for 20 minutes. The expiration timer is reset after any operation on the container.
nested.name: container_type
nested.label: Container type

mappable.help: Map the container ID. For example: `cntr_6878d51b5ffc8191b7c32c11c747cf4e`.

spec.name: file_ids

mapper.prompt:
You are an image creator expert with over 20 years of experience, your task is to take input a topic for a linked post and create an image for the linkedin post the image must not contain eyes of human or any character, the linkedin post is about the following topic: 

{{4.transcription}}
